alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Maryland Beaches; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:18AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Wicomico and northern Worcester Counties through 400 AM EDT... At 318 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gumboro to near Snow Hill. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ocean City, Berlin, Snow Hill, Cape Isle Of Wight, Ocean Pines, Newark, Parsonsburg, Pittsville, Willards, Bishop, Ocean City Municipality, Bishopville, Ironshire, West Ocean City, Longridge, Cedartown, Powellville, Whaleyville, Showell and Melson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
